feedback.Physical object: Included — A quartz crystal is a tangible, spatially discrete physical object.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Excluded — Although sometimes synthesized, the default referent is a naturally occurring mineral.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — Quartz is entirely inorganic; no biological basis or biomimicry.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — It is rigid, does not change form on its own, and is spatially fixed.
feedback.Structural: Included — Has an internal crystalline structure defined by a regular atomic lattice.
feedback.Perceptible: Included — Clearly perceptible through sight and touch.
feedback.Material form: Included — Possesses a definite material form composed of silicon dioxide.
feedback.Passive: Included — Does not emit, act, or self-modify; it is passively present.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Excluded — It has no inherent purpose unless used by external agents.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Excluded — While it can generate signals in devices, this is not intrinsic to the material itself.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Excluded — It does not process information or signals by design.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Excluded — The object has no internal dynamics or state transformation under ordinary conditions.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — No direct interaction or responsiveness to human input.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Excluded — Quartz may be used in systems, but the entity alone is not system-bound.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Excluded — Has no autonomy or inherent function.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — Not critical on its own to the operation of any system.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — Not inherently symbolic or representative.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — It conveys no messages or encoded communication.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Included — Forms according to strict geometric and chemical rules; crystal symmetry is rule-based.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Does not consist of modular or nested components.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — Does not influence or prescribe behavior.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — Does not refer to or describe its own logic or concept.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Quartz's vibrational regularity enables timekeeping; temporal property is essential in applied contexts.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Its meaning does not flex based on context in a core material sense.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Exists independently of cultural designation.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — Not defined by collective agreement or institutional designation.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — Not tied to any identity or role unless metaphorically assigned.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — No regulation governs quartz itself; usage may be regulated but not the object.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — Not a transmissible cultural or educational artifact in and of itself.
feedback.Visible: Included — It is plainly visible and often visually recognized.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — The object’s identity is stable across contexts.
feedback.Widely known: Included — Widely known and recognized across global populations.
